perturbation.original_text: 4.5. PAYMENT TERMS. Impresse shall pay the fees set forth in Sections 4.2  [SLOTTING FEES], 4.3  [BANNER/NEWSLETTER PURCHASE COMMITMENT] and 4.4  [HOSTING FEE] as an aggregate, totaling $[*] payable in four equal quarterly installments of $[*] beginning on May 31, 2000 and thereafter on August 31, 2000 November 30, 2000 and February 28, 2001, respectively.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.5. PAYMENT TERMS. Impresse shall pay the fees set forth in Sections 4.2  [SLOTTING FEES], 4.3  [BANNER/NEWSLETTER PURCHASE COMMITMENT] and 4.4  [HOSTING FEE] as an aggregate, totaling $[*] payable in four equal quarterly installments of $[*] beginning on June 30, 2000 and thereafter on September 30, 2000 December 31, 2000 and March 31, 2001, respectively.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text creates an in-text contradiction by changing the payment dates. The change introduces uncertainty regarding the actual payment deadline, creating potential disputes.

perturbation.original_text: 4.9. INTEREST. All payments not paid by the date such payments are due shall bear interest from the due date to the date payments are actually paid at the lower of (i) 1% per month or (ii) the maximum rate permitted by law.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.9. INTEREST. All payments not paid by the date such payments are due shall bear interest from the due date to the date payments are actually paid at a fixed rate of 1.5% per month.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text creates an in-text contradiction by removing the 'lower of' clause and setting a fixed interest rate. This creates uncertainty regarding the actual rate to be applied on late payments, creating potential disputes.

perturbation.original_text: 5.1. The Term of this Agreement shall begin on the Effective Date and shall end fifteen months therefrom.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.1. The Term of this Agreement shall begin on the Effective Date and shall end eighteen months therefrom.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text creates an in-text contradiction by extending the term of the agreement. This change introduces uncertainty about the actual end date of the agreement, potentially impacting obligations tied to the term's duration.
